title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 §§ 398-4.7 - Designated representatives

N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 §§ 398-4.7 - Designated representatives

State Regulations
(a) SSI and SSP recipients. (1)

Any individual or couple receiving both
SSI and SSP benefits for whom the SSA has assigned a representative payee or
for whom the SSP recipient has voluntarily designated a representative payee
shall retain the same federally appointed or voluntarily designated
representative payee for purposes of their SSP benefits and such individual
shall be deemed a designated representative with payee authority for NYS
purposes. (2)

Any changes to SSA
representative payees appointed or assigned at the federal level must be
processed through SSA. (b) SSP-only recipients. Individuals or couples receiving SSP-only benefits may request a designated
representative and may grant authority for the designated representative to act
as a payee, or to represent the SSP recipient at a fair hearing, or to assist
in case management by providing and obtaining information about the case. A
designated representative payee is required for a minor child and for those
individuals who have been found to lack capacity under article 81 of the Mental

Hygiene Law or where the need for a designated representative payee is deemed
appropriate under procedures established by the Office. Notes
